\[

\Leftrightarrow a_{k}=2^{k}+2-2 a_{k-1} \\
=2^{k}+2-2\left(2^{k-1}+2-2 a_{k-2}\right) \\
=4 a_{k-2}-2 \\
\Rightarrow a_{k}-\frac{2}{3}=4\left(a_{k-2}-\frac{2}{3}\right)
\end{array}
\]

$$\sqrt{x} = x^{2}.$$

Squaring both sides, we get
$$x = x^{4}.$$

Rearranging, we have
$$x^{4} - x = 0.$$

Factoring out an $x$, we get
$$x(x^{3} - 1) = 0.$$

The solutions to this equation are $x = 0$ and $x = 1.$

Now, we integrate over the region between these two points:
\begin{align*}
\int_{0}^{1} \left( x^{2} - \sqrt{x} \right) \, dx &= \left[ \frac{1}{3}x^{3} - \frac{2}{3}x^{3/2} \right]_{0}^{1} \\
&= \left( \frac{1}{3} - \frac{2}{3} \right) - \left( 0 - 0 \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{3} - \frac{2}{3} \\
&= \frac{-1}{3}.
\end{align*}
